title: New PC Build Budget Concerns
self_text: Hi guys, not sure if this is the right sub but it is one of the largest. I‚Äôm considering buying a PC this Black Friday but am kind of conflicted about what to get. Just to give some context, I used to game on a laptop but I then bought a PS5 and play exclusives and the AAA games on it exclusively. I traded in my laptop for a Macbook for work and such but I still use my Mac for multiplayer games like WoW. I am considering getting a PC because of new exclusives like Starfield and Game Pass. Plush, the mac heats up too quickly. I have a couple of Nest Mini and Nest Hub devices that shall be used for voice control. I also have a Xiaomi desk lamp and a Roborock cleaning robot. I plan to display the Home Assistant dashboard on the Nest Hubs, but I am not sure how that actually works. I have seen the cast option, but still have 2 questions: Is casting a 2 way control, or is it just for showing the dashboard? Can I make the cast always available on the Hub, so that the user can switch between different things on the Hub? Now I need a solution for my radiators. I have seen that the Bosch has released a new version of their Zigbee thermostats. I have shortly used them and they had a problem with overshooting the temperature a lot. I quess that they have fixed that by now with an update, but if I connect HA directly to thermostats without a bridge, I wouldn't get the updates. The other option would be to get Tado devices, which are not Zigbee, but I have seen that they should work with HomeKit in Home Assistant. I guess that Tado software is more mature than Bosch and has more functionality overall. Finally, I could get Aqara thermostats for almost the same money as Tado, but I was not really impressed with the build quality... Is there any way to update the devices without a bridge and cloud, but directly via Zigbee for example? Do Tado work locally with HA and HomeKit? How does Tado integrate into HA? I plan to automate lighting again, but this time probably with Shelly devices instead of Sonoff. I guess they are a fair bit better too... Which Zigbee stick would you choose? ConBee II or Sonoff Plus? Do you maybe have some other advice for me? What should I consider or take care about? Thanks a lot!!! :)

self_text: So on Catholic twitter someone made a post saying that Christ was never depressed. This apparently caused controversy and ended up with a lot of people quoting Scripture passages of Christ experiencing sorrow and grief to debunk her. My twitter account is small so I don't have an audience there, but I really feel like I have to say something about this. Please do NOT go around saying Christ was ever depressed. He was not, ever. Depression is a sickness, its a consequence of the Fall. When you say Christ was ever depressed, you are saying one of two things: either you are saying Christ suffered from a mental illness, that He was mentally ill; or you are downplaying the struggle of depressed people by turning their sickness into a normal human experience. Depression is not normal. It is irrational, it is a cross for many to carry their whole lives. Its an irrational feeling of hopelessness or despair or apathy. Christ
